poem:
**After the Riot News**

Dawn slipped through blinds
to read the paper. Headlines
heavy with flame and stone.
In Rotherham, a hotel burns
where lost souls awaited dawn,
the mob masked by the shadows
of their own anger. Silence
followed fire, as ashes
remember what we forget,
embassies of our own untended hearts.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Share your reaction to the riots that have taken place in parts of the UK Following violent riots over the weekend, Downing Street is expected to hold a Cobra emergency response meeting. On Sunday, around 700 people gathered outside the Holiday Inn Express in Rotherham before clashing with police, as a far-right-led mob of masked rioters tried to set fire to a hotel housing asylum seekers. We’d like to hear from people across the country". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
